results.description:
While all families face challenges, those of us with brothers and sisters who are on the Autism Spectrum experience unusual problems as children, and more complicated issues as adults.  This group seeks to provide a supportive forum to siblings who love their ASD family members.  We often need help finding a balance between being good siblings, helping our parents and still carving out time for our own lives.  Some of our relatives need less help from us, while others need more of our protection and direct assistance.  Given the increased numbers of people with autism, many of us are concerned that alternative housing and work support will not be available when siblings need it most.

If you are an adult sibling of a person with autism who cares and worries about their families, join us! There is strength and support in numbers and you just might enjoy swaaping stories and solutions!
results.name: New York Adult Siblings Living with Autism  Meetup

results.description:
NY novelist Arthur Nersesian  is a prolific novelist with more than  ten novels written in the  last fifteen years.  He is offering for the first time an intensive six week workshop in which he will critique each member's work and share with them the secrets of his successful writing career.  The class will meet once a week and be limited to seven writers who have a work in progress and are serious about getting their work published.

In addition to the workshop, Arthur will give talks based on his own personal experiences regarding:

*Conceiving and plotting a work

*Revising a work upon completion, making it sharper, crisper and better

*The daily discipline of writing (and overcoming blocks)

*How to get your work published, some basic business tips

Anyone interested should submit a fiction writing sample of no more than 3000 words (10 pages) in length. Although his expertise is in the novel form, he will consider short stories, screenplays, and plays. Arthur will then conduct an interview with the most qualified candidates. Payment must be made in advance. Only seven seats are available. Feel free to contact Arthur with any questions.

More about the Author:
Arthur has been published by HarperCollins, Simon & Schuster and Akashic Books. Four of his full-length plays were produced Off-off Broadway, and are now published together as East Village Tetralogy. He wrote the screenplay for one of his books, and last year his third book, Dogrun, was made into a major motion picture, directed by Anthony Edwards, and starring Heather Graham and Gina Gershon. His books have been translated into a half a dozen languages. His short stories, essays, poems and reviews have appeared in various books, magazines and journals.

This is an amazing opportunity to learn in an intimate setting the ins and outs of how to get your work published from someone who has actually done it.
results.name: Intensive Writer Workshop with Real NY Novelist

results.description:
Yes, there is canyoneering in the Northeast!  It might not be Utah, but it isn't half bad either, so come join us,

-Andre

What's a typical trip like? A typical trip involves hiking/bushwhacking to the top of a water course and following it down by rappelling waterfalls (some over 100'), down-climbing, lots of slippery boulder hopping, and bushwhacking. Swims are possible, deep wading probably, and there's always lots of getting splashed on.

NEC is not a guide or training service. All trips are member organized and you are solely responsible for your own safety.  

All participants must be, at minimum:

• Strong hikers able to navigate off-trail and bushwhack across difficult terrain (scree, unstable slopes, slippery stream beds, boulder fields, etc) with heavy ropes and gear.

• Experienced rappellers able to negotiate challenging overhangs, loose rocks, water, slippery footing, and other hazards. Having rappelled once or twice is not "experienced".

• Knowledgeable enough to safety check anchors, rigging, knots and each other. 

What about less experienced members?

You can join the meetup, but cannot come on trip without proper training.

NEC is not a guiding or instructional service and does not provide training, but there are a few other options:

1) The best way to get started is to take a 3 day course from a professional instructor in the Zion, Moab, or Los Angeles areas.  Unfortunately there are no instructors on the East Coast. 

2) The second best way is to learn rappelling and anchor building from another sport like technical caving, ice climbing, mountaineering, or outdoor rock climbing (rocks gyms do not count). Canyoneering techniques are a little different but the foundation skills are enough to join our trips. 

In time there will an online resource section to supplement formal training with canyoneering-specific techniques and some informal members-hosted skill building practice sessions.
results.name: Northeast Canyoneering

results.description:
Feminism, ah--a word that carries so much baggage. Let's unearth it. Let's talk street harassment. Let's talk gender. Let's talk theory. Let's talk empowerment. Let's talk love. 

People of all sexes and genders and nonsexes and nongenders from NYC and beyond are welcome; men will sometimes be asked in posts to forgo a meet.

What is woman? 
Are there things about her that escape the conditioned influences of her character?
How do capitalism and patriarchy make sense of this creature?
 Is there freedom for woman in patriarchy?
What is the aim of the street harasser and how can we subvert them?
How can we react to oppression--let alone spot it, declare it for what it is?
How can we recognize the oppressor within ourselves?
How is feminism too often racialized?

Hell, what does that word feminism even mean?

Welcome to The Feminist Salon!
results.name: The Feminist Salon

results.description:
We all have an instinctual need for human touch. In this chaotic, individualistic society we live in however, asking for help in fulfilling this most basic, most beautifully human desire has become taboo- a signal of weakness- especially among men. I started this group because I genuinely feel that so many of our ills and traumas could begin to be healed if we allowed ourselves to love and be loved in a completely unselfish, non-sexual way. I hope to host meetups at places like movie theatres, cafes and eventual members' homes, where we sit, hold each other, and talk about whatever might be on our minds. You will learn that it's okay to let other people in, and that it's okay to say no. You'll learn that you are enough and you are loved.
I encourage you, straight or gay, to give this a shot. I know this can change the world, if only we trust in the immense power of physical connection.
results.name: Cuddling Men NYC

This group is for Asian single, separated, and divorced parents and their families. The purpose of this group is to provide a social forum for asian parents and their toddler to school-age children of similar circumstance to get together for quality group activities. Single parenthood has it’s unique challenges and experiences. No matter how you arrived in you current situation, it’s important for families and children to know they are not alone. Folks are always willing to lend a sympathetic ear.

We host a wide variety of events both for kids and adults. Join us and come out for some events! You may find the camaraderie to be just what you're looking for.  The members are cool, the events are fun, the experiences are priceless.

Please note that for the safety of members and their children, all applicants will be screened by an organizer before acceptance into the group.  Once you apply, an organizer will contact you via Meetup's message system.  Please make sure you check your Meetup messages.

This is NOT a singles dating group and is not meant for members to browse for dates or potential relationships. If that is your reason for seeking membership, please consider joining one of the many other terrific Meetup groups for singles.  Parents without significant custodial time would not be an ideal fit for the activities within this group.

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in discussing various topics on Japan and Korea over coffee. I started this group because both countries have equally fascinating people and cultures, yet few know well enough about both countries. We'll meet once a month to discuss various topics (in English) regarding two countries, ranging from foods and cultures to political relations and history. If there is enough interest, we can even invite local professors or professionals to learn in depth about our topic of interest regarding the two countries. Our goal is to build friendships and create values by learning different perspectives, not to argue who is right or wrong. This group is also not limited to Koreans and Japanese, but open to anyone who is interested in this topic. Feel free to swing by, meet friends, and share your thoughts!

results.description:
Tribute band shows are so much fun and often provide terrific live music experiences in small venues!  It's really amazing the level of dedication so many of these musicians put forth in perfecting not only the music, but the look, character, and personas of some of the most iconic and epic bands in history.   We are lucky to live in a spot with a wide variety of tribute acts which keep alive the legendary bands of the past.

Here we especially focus on classic rock tribute acts (Led Zeppelin, The Who, Rush, Pink Floyd, etc) but infuse other rock sub-genres: 80s new wave (The Smiths, The Cars, R.E.M.), 80s hard rock/arena rock/'hair band' (Guns N Roses, Def Leppard, Bon Jovi etc), and ‘softer’ rock (Billy Joel, Elton John, etc). There is ‘more' too with eclectic cover bands who frequently play in the area, such as The Nerds, The Mighty Spectrum, Back to the Garden 1969, The Ready Steady 60s, and The Ronald Reagans, just to name a few.

We are in need of event hosts, especially in NJ, NYC, and Long Island, so if anyone would like to be one and schedule an event, please let me know really soon!
results.name: Hudson Valley TRIBUTE BAND ROCKERS

results.description: Are you interested in becoming an effective public speaker and improving your listening skills? At $60 for six months it is also one of the most cost-effective skill-building tools available anywhere. Consider joining Harlem Toastmasters. The club is one of the 14,650 clubs of Toastmasters International. Toastmasters clubs operate in 126 countries. Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Members of Toastmasters improve their speaking skills by attending recurring meetings where they deliver speeches or evaluate other speakers. Membership in Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. How Does It Work? A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a no-pressure atmosphere. There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure.
results.name: Harlem Toastmasters Meetup

results.description:
This is a group of people interested in viewing, collecting, discussing, learning and making Art Jewelry, Custom Jewelry, Fine Jewelry Collections, Silversmithing, Goldsmithing and Metalsmithing. 

Every 3rd Sunday a process demonstration will be conducted in the studio at 2:30pm, this will take place during the Hoboken Gallery Walk.  We can exchange information about various techniques used to make jewelry, silversmithing or goldsmithing.  You are welcome to request a technique or do a demonstration of your own. (please set up in advance)

Meetups will be held in my studio at the Monroe Arts Center, art jewelry galleries, museums and other studios or venues that share interest in art jewelry.  

I would like to share information about the art jewelry community, up and coming events, conferences, openings and competitions happening around our community and outside. I would like to create a dialog about topics that include tools, techniques, processes, materials and why we make what we make.  I think we could learn a lot from each other. 

EatMetal, Inc studio includes a gallery space, workbenches for students, a communal workspace and my own personal work space. I will host open houses, events to preview my new fine jewelry collections, one of a kind pieces and small scale sculpture. Guest jewelry artist's will be invited to come and show their work in the gallery.  All level classes are offered in the fall, winter and spring for an 8 week session. The focus is on core fundamentals and honing your skills. Great fun at the studio is Evening or Afternoon One Day Workshops @ EatMetal, Inc. which center on one project and you get to Bring Your Bling Home!  


Look forward to seeing you in the studio!

The mission of this group is to enable careerwomen with current, active, ongoing careers to network and socialize with each other in order to educate, emotionally support career women in their careers and in their career-focused lifestyles. It is create a outlet for women to discuss different topics that affect careerwomen every day including individual-specific topics like navigating in your career, overcoming challenges at work, e.g., making alliances with key people in the office-- as well as external factors like the global, national, local business/economy,  the glass ceiling, when will be the first female president.  Whether you are in an ambitious mode or cruising in your job, this is the outlet for you to have a voice about these topics. But do not be fooled - much bantering and jokes are welcome -- we are here to get to know each other.  While networking is encouraged, sales /self marketing is prohibited.

If you are trying to reconnect with new female contacts who are ambitious, intelligent and educated like you, please join us and let's talk shop from female point of view! 

These conversation topics are encouraged: travel, movies, music as well as the intellectual topics like economics, business, finance, even politics and perhaps technology that is ever changing and affecting business.

results.description:
Soaring Spirits is an organization  run by widowed people, that connects widowed people world wide. Our goal is to give you hope and to let you know that you're not alone. We have Regional Groups all over the US and are starting one here in NYC. It's a social group where we all connect and share. Although our group is open to anyone in the NY/NJ area or anyone who wants to travel for a social event, most of our meet-ups are in Manhattan. Sometimes we meet in other buroughs as well. This is a social hang-out group, not a support group, although we do offer each other plenty of support.  

 We're all inclusive - no matter your age, sex, religion (or lack thereof), sexual preference, relationship status, etc. This is NOT a dating service, it's a place to connect and make friends. We meet 2x per month at local restaurants, parks, beaches, movies, plays, museums, and many other fun events. If you have lost the person you planned on spending the rest of your life with to death, and you'd like to meet other people who "get it", give us a try. Welcome.

results.description:
The Greenwich Library Foreign Affairs Book Club has been providing lively discussions of books focused on foreign affairs, international issues, and US economic and political themes for the last 7+ years. Our core group of 12-15 welcomes all those interested in joining the discussion.

We meet monthly (Sept-June) often on the 3rd Tuesday at the Greenwich Library.  (Check the front desk for to see which meeting room we're in).

Our current members have a variety of experiences and a wealth of personal history and perspective to share from past careers and/or travel.  We've had people come for one topic, never to see them again, and others who have been stalwart attendees from Day 1.

We try to find books that are not too long (300 page targeted maximum), that might appeal to a broader audience (so we can justify the Library buying a few copies), and that are on topics that our readers are looking to explore.  

I've listed the books we've reviewed over the last few years on a page in the Pages section so that you can get a feel for our style.

Feel free to join us to just observe the discussion, or dive right in.
results.name: Greenwich Library Foreign Affairs Book Club

results.description:
We'd like to share experiences building scalable monitoring and alerting solutions using Graphite, Grafana, Collectd, Nagios, Logstash, Elasticsearch and Kibana, among others.

We believe that it is easy to collect metrics from any one system, and to define alerts on single metrics. We already have this capability in place. However, in complex systems, the real operational challenges arise from the way system components interact. Some of these components live inside our data center, some live outside our data center, and all are updating on differing timelines. The functionality and performance of every component has the potential to change every day.

Our challenge is to identify patterns and correlations across multiple systems in our stack. We need to integrate top-down and bottom-up analysis, so we can see, for example, that trial subscription signups (a user metric) fell off at the same time that an internal API call began to fail (an application metric), and it was caused by a database host falling offline (a system metric).

When collecting so much data, there is a risk of being overwhelmed and not being able to make sense of it all. In essence, a risk of collecting data but not producing intelligence. We combat this risk by converting our accumulated data into the most visually information-dense format available: graphs. Then we make graphs easy to compare and easy to share. We make them informative at a glance and easy for the team to keep watching. Finally, once we are regularly identifying patterns across our graphs, we should have an automated way to "watch the graphs" in our absence. It is not an AI or a pattern recognition "black box", it should just automate patterns that humans have first validated to be meaningful.
results.name: Monitoring NYC

results.description:
NJ Tech Hardware Startups is a group serving both New Jersey and New York. We look forward to collaborating among entrepreneurs, inventors, Hobbyists, new product development of large companies, engineers, scientists, and others. 

We believe that “…Hardware is the New Software” but is extremely complex and in need of people from almost all market and technology areas. Our hope is to help people accelerate the process, and reduce the risk of moving from Concept to Production and Market. Or, to learn about new ways of designing, prototyping, building and fulfilling tech hardware, software, systems & Components. 

We will be focused on many facets of the Tech Hardware Community including Business (Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Finance, Legal and Operations), Technology, Manufacturing, Positioning, and other facets to bring software integrated hardware systems to market and expansion. 

This is the place to collaborate with and learn from others who are: 

• Considering starting up a Tech Hardware type company, 
• Tinkering around with various technologies to test their ability to solve more problems and increase their effectiveness
 • New to the industry and simply curious about what is possible
 • Trying to figure out how to bring your concept or idea from a concept to a prototype
 • Evaluating manufacturing options for high volume production of your product through either off-Shore or on-Shore or both
 • Assessing the market value and investment options for hardware companies.  

We look to bring to light, discussion, and problem solving of challenges and opportunities of Tech Hardware products and cover the high growth areas of:
• Additive Manufacturing - 3D Printing
• Electronics 
 • Telematics
•  M2M
•  IoT – Internet of Things
 •  Robotics
•  Tech Fashion - including Wearables) 
 •  And what ever you need help with! 

We are bringing all stakeholders in the startup and growth stage business cycle to this group and ensure that companies, looking to manufacture and develop products, are organized for success. You will collaborate with and learn from:
• Angel, VC, Private Equity, and other Investors
• Engineers– all disciplines (i.e. mechanical, software, materials, electrical, textile, etc.)
 • Entrepreneurs
 • Manufacturers and Operations
 • Inventors, Hobbyists, and Tinkerers
 • Marketers
 • Developers
 • Applied and Basic Researchers
 • Professionals and Business Executives
 • Technologists - Software, Hardware and Systems
• Transportation & Logistics.

 Hope to see you soon.

results.description:
Welcome to SOCCER FOR FUN!  We are a Co-Ed Adult Soccer Club for those who love the game of soccer and are searching for a friendly and exciting atmosphere to enjoy it. Our players' skills range from beginners to more advanced players that enjoy playing more relaxed games than those found in competitive leagues.

Our games will be held primarily at Raymond O'Conner Park 33rd Avenue & Corporal Kennedy St. Bayside NY 11361  or at Alley Pond Sports Center Park located at corner of Union Turnpike and Winchester Blvd, Queens Village (79-20 Winchester Blvd, Queens Village, NY 11427) starting at 9:00 AM sharp! Members should always check the site for any updates on the venue and times. We will host various games from small pug games to big field 11 v. 11 games to exciting tournaments throughout the year.  In addition to our weekly games from time to time we will host other events such as attending professional soccer matches, viewing sporting events at local pubs, annual BBQ and so on.  

Code of Conduct

·  Never be disrespectful to other players or opponents

·  Foul language will be frowned upon and unacceptable

·  Obey the RSVP rules

Rules of Play

·  Slide tackling, high kicks or rough play strictly prohibited

·  Penalties in the box if intentional are taken otherwise kicks are always indirect (except during a tournament)

·  Not all games will have referees so please respect any call made by any player on the field.  All disputes will be settled by your Team Captain.

RSVP Rules

If you sign up and make a team for the game you are expected at the field ready, willing and able to play.  All Members can update their RSVP before teams are posted the night before the game.  If you fail to update timely or to show up at a game you will not be permitted to sign up for the next two weeks.  If you fail to show twice you will not be able to sign up for two months.  This rule is enforced in order to get the players on the field that want to play especially if there is a waiting list.  Any and all emergencies will be taken under consideration and any last minute drops if you notify your organizers we will try to get a replacement player for the game thereby preventing a no show.  Our goal is to have full games each week and getting as many members on the field as possible.

Our Club’s mission is to provide a warm, friendly and safe environment for players to come and enjoy Soccer.
results.name: SOCCER FOR FUN

results.description:
This group is for local history buffs - those who want to learn more about our City - either on foot or through slide show/lecture. There are many organizations that offer walks and talks led by docents and experts - some free, some for nominal cost ($20 or under).  

Posted events are open to the public and run by public organizations and licensed tour guides.  Some require pre-registration.  Read the description of the event carefully.  An RSVP on meetup does not mean you have registered for the event.  You will sometimes need to registered beforehand on an organization website or pay in advance to guarantee a spot.

This meetup differs from other walking meetups in that we will only be attending curated events rather than wandering around exploring or being led by the Meetup organizer.  We will be attending tours and lectures offered by tour guides, historical societies, preservation groups among others.   Some events will be in a bar or cafe or other informal place, but some will be more formal classroom style.  We will be meeting up either AT the event or AFTER the event but NOT BEFORE the event.   

Some events have an organizer - the organizer will attend the event and bring a Meetup sign and look for other group members.  Members can group together during the event (i.e., sit together at a lecture) or socialize afterwards.  The organizer cannot always guarantee that you will have a spot at the event unless you pre-register or pay the sponsor of the event.

Some events will not have an organizer.  Those events are posted to inform members of things that are happening in case anyone would like to attend on their own or with friends.  Anyone can become a co-organizer by messaging the organizer, so if there is an event you would like to share, or you would like others to attend with you, please step up.

All posted events are run by organizations or licensed tour guides.  If there is any payment for the event it is made directly to the organization or the tour guide giving the tour.

Have fun and enjoy the events!

Linda Fisher

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in 3D printing or seeing awesome things being created. 

Although the landscape is changing there's still not enough resources for first time makers. Whether you've made prints before or simply think the concept sounds awesome, we invite you to join our live and online 3d printing classes. All skill levels are welcome. 

For our in-person classes in NY and BK, we want everyone to have the chance to get hands-on experience using a 3D printer and one-on-one training to go from having a great idea to producing a physical object.  

We offer live webinars as well so those who cannot make our in-person classes can still learn. 

In our classes we teach how a 3D printer works, answer questions and guide folks through the process of creating their first print. No supplies, experience or expertise needed. 

For those looking for more advanced insight into 3D printing we will have folks available for any specific questions. 

You should join our group if you are interested in learning about 3d printing, meeting other 3D printing users, if you own a 3d printer and want exclusive access our awesome software, or like testing out software and hardware in one of the fastest growing industries.   

If you have any projects, ideas or tricks for 3D Printing you'd like to discuss please share them with the group as well! 

Happy printing!

Aaron and Charles

results.description:
True Business Bliss is not about $$ profit, it's all about empowering your greatest asset, YOU!!!

Solopreneurs don't have to go it alone!  Join us for valuable support!

Join us and thrive!!  This is not your average (old-style) networking event! 

I created this group because, for me, traditional networking is a real turnoff.  I'd get up early or stay late and leave these events with  little value received - for anyone but the organizer.  I'd hate the food and take home a bunch of cards meaning little when I didn't even remember who gave them to me.

Here, in the Business Bliss Studio, we're dedicated to authentic connection and growing you so you can grow your business.  We're blending business, fun and retreat so you can master true "Business Bliss."  Master the (5) Keys to success (see below). 

Startup entrepreneurs, solopreneurs and conscious business entrepreneurs will really appreciate the support and wisdom we share.

Join us:

• For festive, joyful, authentic social connection & networking!

• Feed your creative soul!

• Experience mindfulness and focused support! 

THE GATHERINGS:

• Breakfast Bliss: These are our morning meetings.  Healthy minds, health food, and lots of individual support. I keep the morning meetings small so you can receive the support you need from the group, and I can share my whole heart and expertise.  We open with mindfulness practice, give you 10 minutes to receive support on the topic of your choice, and close with a mindfulness practice.  Focus, fun, creative support!

• Social Bliss: These are our afternoon or evening social gatherings all about passion and fun!!  Music, food, culture, drinks (alcoholic or non) and authentic, natural networking.  In 2016, we'll expand our circle and partner with other groups and Meetups.

True, sustainable success comes with profit and peace.  No matter what you know in your mind, true success comes from the deepest part of you and your soul.  Your inner entrepreneur is the source of your energy, creativity, confidence, connection.  

Know you, know & define your greater success!  Nurture your connections and grow rich!!!  

Solopreneurs desire freedom and feedback!  Entrepreneurs know it can get lonely, working from home, wearing all of the hats, making all the decisions, 

Think Creative Mastermind + Natural Networking +  Life Support (aka self-care). We're mixing business and retreat to help you access the the 5 keys to success: 

• Clarity. 

• Confidence.

• Creativity. 

• Community. 

• Mindset.  

I'll find the spaces and bring the expertise.  You come to learn, share feedback in our circle, and receive support from me and the other awesome Business Bliss Masters.  

Bring your ideas, let us help you brainstorm.  Bring your biz questions, and let me, and our members help you get answers.  We'll end each session with a mindfulness practice, e.g., meditation, visualization.  This is about heart-centered networking and support.  Creative co-creation rocks!

Networking happens naturally, as you engage in a community of like-hearted entrepreneurs, that speak your language, and have your best interest at heart. 

I believe that growing and sustaining your business shouldn't have to mean burnout.  It's time to slow down to speed up your success so you can know less stress, more creativity, productivity and joy in your life and business.   

Join us if you are a mindful entrepreneur that likes to give and receive support from other awesome entrepreneurs, appreciates mindfulness & meditation, and would love getting out of the office on inspirational outings.

P.S. I invite you to join us and complement this with other groups that are 100% dedicated to networking.  Grow you with us to radiate confidence and power and rock the house as you network in other groups.


Karen McMillan  | YINpreneur
results.name: Business Bliss - NYC Mindful Mastermind & Natural Networking

results.description:
This is a group about how to live more consciously.

We work with issues you want to talk about (e.g., my relationship is on the skids; I'm miserable in my career; I have anxiety; anything at all) and then see what they look like through the lens of any or all of these ancient, universally spiritual concepts:

Be Compassionate • Beliefs Matter • Be Present • Choices Abound • Everything Is Energy • Have an Attitude of Gratitude • Intentions Matter • Judgments Separate Us • Listen to Inspiration • Mind and Body Are Connected • Take Responsibility • The Law of Attraction Is Always On • We Are All Connected • We Are Here for a Reason • We Belong to the Planet, Not the Planet to Us

So if you generally nod your head in agreement with these concepts and are interested in seeing what happens to your Life when you integrate them more and more into your daily experience, grab an issue, grab a friend, and accept my invitation to come to a drop-in class and learn how to live a bit more consciously.

I come and go from my native New York and am thrilled to share this down-to-earth, dynamic, compelling and thought-provoking practice with you while I'm here. I look forward to meeting you and working out some stuff. :)

P.S.  I have taught Spiritual Workout for Entrepreneurs in San Francisco for much of 2014 and here are what some of those folks have said about this class (and it's the same for entrepreneurs and everyone else):


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rOl-bhemoag

results.description:
Please join the Manhattan Robin Hood Tax on Wall street meetup site for now to be invited to specific local meetups , and local meetup groups as they develop. Bottom line: when someone suffers an Economic Injustice in America we all suffer.

Help us Stop Wall Street Greed hurting ordinary Americans

Time to take back our Government from Wall Street’s control. Tax Wall Street, the 1%, for Human Needs not Wall Street Greed. For a Robin Hood Tax on Wall street - because when someone suffers an Economic Injustice in America we all suffer. Warren Buffet has declared: “Stop Coddling the Super-Rich” and we agree! Please Join Warren and support the Robin Hood sales tax on Wall Street stock and bond trades.

Sign up on Robin’s Facebook Page at: http://www.Facebook.com/RobinHoodTaxUSA/
Sign Up on Robin’s Web site at: http://www.RobinHoodTax.org/ The Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street can be the game changer for a fairer, more democratic, humane, balanced, and moral American Tax System. The Robin Hood Tax can mean slightly less for the 1% at the top and lots more for the 99% below.

Web Page: http://RobinHoodTax.org/
Please Endorse and Volunteer: https://www.facebook.com/RobinHoodTaxUsa/app_1002658966903...
Main FB Page: https://www.facebook.com/RobinHoodTaxUSA
Please follow our twitter page: @RobinHoodTax
New York Pages on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/NewYorkCitizensforTheRobinHoodTax..., New York City Citizens for The Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street, CUNY Students, Staff, Faculty & Alumni for The Robin Hood Tax on Wall St
As American’s, every day we delay in implementing the Robin Hood Tax the Super Rich have more power and we have fewer options. Acting now is in America’s best interest.


The Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street is the game changer for a fairer, more democratic, humane, balanced, and moral American Tax System

This tiny sales tax on Wall Street is:
.5% on stocks, just $.50 (50 cents) for each $100 of stock trades;
.1% on bonds, just $.10 (ten cents) for each $100 of bond trades;
.005% on derivative speculation in currencies, commodities, or other trades, just $.005 (half a penny) for each $100 of trades

The revenue generated is estimated by economists to be up to 350 billion each year! The Robin Hood Tax can mean slightly less for the 1% at the top and lots more for the 99% below.

Our Current Sales Tax System Does Not Tax the Items That the Top 10% American Households (by Wealth) almost exclusively own.
Things everyone has to buy have a Sales Tax like toilet paper, toothpaste, cars, condo’s and homes. Things only the top 10% of Wealthy Households buy have no sales tax. Sadly that’s True.

Even Worse the top ten percent of American Households have 81% to 94% of stocks, bonds, trust funds, and business equity, and almost 80% of non-home real estate. Since financial wealth is what counts as far as the control of income-producing assets, we can say that just 10% of the people own the United States of America. Sadly this is another clear example of: Those that have the gold get to make the rules.

Organizations representing over 100,000,000 Americans are now involved with the American Robin Hood Tax Campaign. Thousands of endorsers, 100’s of Organization endorsers, over 1,000 economists, the Vatican, Some of the brightest minds in the country and the 4 of the richest men in America, have endorsed the Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street.

Three Benefits of the Robin Hood Tax
Although every Robin Hood Tax has its own specific intended purpose, there are some general intended purposes which are common to most of them. Below are some of those general commonalities. The intended purpose may or may not be achieved.
Curbing volatility of financial markets
In 1936, when Keynes first proposed a financial transaction tax, he wrote, "Speculators may do no harm as bubbles on a steady stream of enterprise. But the situation is serious when enterprise becomes the bubble on a whirlpool of speculation." Rescuing enterprise from becoming "the bubble on a whirlpool of speculation" was also an intended purpose of the Robin Hood Tax and is a common theme in several other types of financial transaction taxes.
More fair and equitable tax collection
Another common theme is the proposed intention to create a system of more fair and equitable tax collection. An Automated Payment Robin Hood tax taxes the broadest possible tax base, namely all transactions including all financial asset transactions. Instead of introducing progressivity through the tax rate structure, the flat rate introduces progressiveness through the tax base since the highest income and wealth groups undertake a disproportionate share of financial transactions.
According to several leading figures, the "fairness" aspect of a financial transaction tax has eclipsed, and/or replaced, "prevention of volatility" as the most important purpose for the tax. Fraser Reilly-King of Halifax Initiative is one such economist: he sees a Robin Hood Tax as important for bringing a more equitable balance to the taxation of all parts of the economy.[23]
Less susceptible to tax evasion than alternatives
According to some economists, a financial transaction tax is less susceptible to tax avoidance and tax evasion than other types of taxes proposed for the financial sector. An Automated Payment Robin Hood Tax employs 21st century technology for automatically assessing and collecting taxes when transactions are settled through the electronic technology of the banking payments system. Stop Blaming the Poor for Wall Streets Greed

Warren Buffett isn’t the only rich guy who wants to higher taxes on the rich, such as The Robin Hood tax which he has specifically endorsed. A survey from Spectrem Group found that 68% of millionaires (those with investments of $1 million or more) support raising taxes on those with $1 million or more in income. Fully 61% of those worth of $5 million or more support increased taxes on million-plus earners.
results.name: Manhattan - Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street Campaign Events

results.description:
New York has a long, rich history of night photography. William Fraser, Alfred Steiglitz, Edward Steichen and other great luminaries walked the same streets we do today, capturing some of the world's most notable low light photographs. 

Join us after the sun goes down to explore what your camera is capable of when you leave the shutter open long enough. We'll re-explore familiar locations to see things in a new light and work with each other to light things in new ways. 

Our goal is to follow the footsteps of the original Camera Club of New York around the turn of the previous century to collaborate and forge a community for the long term that can host group shows and work together to create new works. We plan on Meetups at least every other month and more if there is demand. Come out and spend the night with us.

Here's what you need:

• A camera with manual settings.  Film, digital, whatever, we like them all.

• A tripod (not for every meetup though!)

• A remote for your camera, hopefully an intervalometer that can be programmed)

That's it.  We're not looking only for DSLR people, we've seen amazing stuff come from Micro 4/3 point and shoots, so don't be ashamed of your gear!
results.name: New York Night Photographers

results.description: This is a group for those wanting to learn more about stock selection and trading based on investment principles articulated by Richard D. Wyckoff. Wyckoff was an early twentieth century market technician and educator who documented timeless strategies for understanding and profiting in all kinds of markets. Group meetings will be online and cover basic and intermediate concepts of the Wyckoff Method as well as Wyckoff analysis of current markets. We will discuss Wyckoff labeling and interpretation of trading ranges, anticipation and development of trends, and stock selection criteria using filters based on supply/demand and relative/comparative strength. Please join us for ongoing educational discussions and opportunities.

results.description:
Contrary to popular belief, the phrase "Christian Young Professional" is not an oxymoron. The two interests/pursuits are in fact not exclusive of each other :) This group is for those people that are active in their Christian faith and consider themselves to be a "young professional". You may network and sometimes attend events with your peers in your respective industry, however, you would like to join a closer community of folks that perhaps say, "I want to experience much, if not all, that the city offers, however, I wish to do so through a greater consciousness of my relationship with Christ". 

So will each meetup be at some TBD church?? No. Most may likely already attend a church regularly, so let's do something else you enjoy doing. Perhaps it's a Hillsong/Jesus Culture/Propaganda concert? Perhaps it's dinner, movies, or just getting to know each other over coffee? Maybe it's a 5K or a play? What do you like? I'll start by proposing/scheduling a few events for the upcoming weekends.  Potential events will be in both NYC and Jersey City!

Hopefully, the basic concept of the group (Christian + Young Professional) appeals to you, and with your feedback, we will improve upon the experience the group offers!

And all that believed were together, and had all things common; (‭Acts‬ ‭2‬:‭44‬)

results.description:
Many of us aspire to be artistic in one form or the other, but we carry within us hindrances to either doing our work or moving it out into the world (commonly called “marketing”) -- or both. We think we are not good enough, our work is not good enough, will be judged, we lack enough talent or imagination or commitment or time, we can’t trust the future, we need more ambition and drive, and on and on. We cannot get beyond our fears and start doing our artistic work full-out and then putting our work out there for others to experience. We become closeted artists, and if we do manage to express ourselves artistically, we shy away from sharing it with others, with the world — full-out. We fear criticism mostly. Failure. Rejection. We want to be approved of, to be appreciated and recognized. Being appreciated is not bad, but when it becomes more important than our self-expression, it doesn't bring any fulfillment at all. Mainly, we are just too self-critical. There is nothing holding us back but us. When we see this negative pattern with gentle guidance, we can laugh at the illogic of it all and move into doing our creative work with passion and inspiration. The seriousness is gone, so our "work" becomes our "play." We will use The Work of Byron Katie, a powerful but gentle tool for self-investigation, to get at our deep, underlying beliefs that stop us from fulfilling our dreams to write, dance, paint, sculpt, act, play music, make a movie, cook, create a business, do anything that we want to do. Join us and get to work on the beliefs and fears that stop you from being the fully creative person you secretly want to be. For more information about Byron Katie and her work, go to thework.com or read her book Loving What Is. There are plenty of youtube.com videos of Katie doing The Work with others and explaining how The Work works.  Another good addition to this meetup is my meetup "Marketing for Artists and Other Creative People" at http://www.meetup.com/Marketing-for-Artists-and-Other-Creative-People/grow/ 

I hope to see you soon at our meet up!    Ben, Your Organizer
results.name: Unblocking Your Creativity

results.description:
The Institute for Architectural Research is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) collaborative forum, created to foster the purpose of pursuing architectural fundamentals. The Institute’s research focuses on matters of perception, image fabrication, cultural ecology, and spatial relationships between human experiences and societal concerns. The Institute is open to anyone with interest and appreciation of architecture, design, and art, while embracing the urban culture of New York City.

By joining this group, you will become part of the Institute's collaborative architectural community. We will notify Meetup members on architecture social events, lectures, exhibits, and workshops relating to art, design, history and theory. 

Workshops offered by the Institute are for both beginning and advanced designers. Classes include college architecture preparatory courses for high school and college undergraduate students, portfolio design, hand drawing classes, and tutorials on digital design programs. We offer a wide range of opportunities, for all levels of experience, to learn about architectural principles. Our initiative is to link aspiring architects, artists, and designers with experienced professionals in order to promote a unique mode of learning.

Funding for events, in a large part, comes from donations, but in some cases, we may need to charge workshops to provide for materials and time. (100% of every purchase goes into yearly programming in teaching and research at the Institute for Architectural Research, Inc.) However, cost is free for members of the public with low income, this also includes students in middle and high school, or students currently enrolled in a University. Approval of free admissions will be review by the board of directors. If you would like to waive the cost of any workshop, please email admissions@architecturalresearch.org.

The core value of the Institute for Architectural Research is to cultivate a shared educational environment, seeking architectural innovations from all urban cultural backgrounds. The Institute encourages new ideas, concepts, and sharing of research in a diverse multicultural environment in the metropolitan area of New York.

Sincerely,

Scott Aker, AIA, LEED AP BD+C and Michael Sciarrillo, AIA

Founders

Please visit us, the Institute for Architectural Research, Inc. @ www.architecturalresearch.org
results.name: Architectural Sketching: Eye and Image

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in the use of artificial intelligence for creativity, with emphasis in music and visual arts.

Adding a little bit of history to the purpose of this group, I would like to mention my interest in Eurythmics, which was the study of harmony and proportion, by observation of beauty in mathematical ratios, a concept proposed by Pythagoras. 

Eurhythmics could be used to analyze and create all forms of art: music, painting, architecture, etc., and until the middle ages, subjective and objective branches of knowledge such as arithmetic, music, geometry and astronomy (bundled with astrology) thrived together and united as a group known as the Quadrivium.

During that time, knowledge of the Quadrivium was considered a pre-requisite for the study of philosophy, but it fell apart in the Renaissance, when mathematicians became increasingly uninterested in the arts because no theory had successfully provided a link between aesthetics and proportion.

Within the context of data science and artificial intelligence, I hope this group allows participants to discuss and share views to help establish analytical links in the fields or arts, science, and creativity.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/TheQuadrivi...

topics.name: Work On your Business VS. Working in Your Business

results.description:
Have you had a dream of running your own business with passion & purpose?

Have you ever felt unappreciated, underpaid or even worse not enjoying going to work?

Have you ever felt fearful financially or emotionally when thinking on you need to make a change but feel trapped & don't know how?

Have you ever dreamed of having a better life, full of excitment, purpose, & a knowing that your adding value to the world & getting paid really well for it, making a 6 or 7 digit annual salary doing what you're passionate about?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because as a coach, seminar leader, and successful entrepreneur I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time struggle financially & emotionally knowing where we work is not who we are.

The purpose of this group is to ignite passion & hope, inspire & support members to create & share there dreams on paper so they know the direction they'd like to go as well as how to proceed.

You'll become aware of the freedom on SO many levels that you can create when you begin to focus your energies on your dream.  You'll have the support from myself & the amazing team of members that want to succeed with you!

Throughout these Meetups I'll be teaching you the processes on how to begin your business without any risk. You'll learn the amazing techniques, tools, and processes to build momentum & desire.

What gives me the right?  I, who at one time was borderline bankrupt, a financial mess, miserable, & hopeless that I'd ever be able to change, am now living a life I once only dreamed of! From building companies from scratch, selling them for hundreds of thousands of dollars, to retiring in my twenties, to becoming a millionaire, & failing more than most people would probably ever admit, I can't wait to share the secrets I've learned over the years.

Are you ready to decide once in for all that you deserve more.  Are you ready to learn & implement these amazing concepts into your life so you too can be on the road to freedom? Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to mentor & facilitate sharing amongst each other in this amazing group.

Matthew Croteau

From building companies from scratch, selling them for hundreds of thousands of dollars, to retiring in my twenties, to becoming a millionaire, & failing more than most people would probably ever admit, I can't wait to share the secrets I've learned over the years.

Are you ready to decide once in for all that you deserve more.  Are you ready to learn & implement these amazing concepts into your life so you too can be on the road to freedom? Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to mentor & facilitate sharing amongst each other in this amazing group.

Matthew Croteau

results.description:
Budding entrepreneurs have more freedom and resources than any other time in history to start and grow a business from their own home. It’s this spirit of personal endeavour and self-determination that is driving our economic recovery. But home businesses don’t just fire up the economic engines and create jobs, they turn dormitory towns into living communities, they keep our streets safer, and by driving down car emissions, cleaner too. The home is now the most popular place to start and grow a business. One in 10 domestic properties are now home to at least 1 business and contribute $500 billion to the economy.
These are not people starting businesses out of necessity through lack of jobs, they are part of a growing movement that is responding to the new opportunities technology brings and actively taking control of their own destiny by starting out from home.
They are hard-working people who now have the capability to trade globally from their own kitchen table. They are growing through outsourcing work to other home-based individuals and as they do so, they are bringing important employment opportunities to rural as well as urban areas all over true world. There is no such thing as a typical or average home business. They range from the professional services like accountants, to creative industries like children’s books and fashion, to manufacturers of frozen baby food.
Our Work At Home Lifestyles Meetup group, meet through an informal coffee and tea meeting to meet, share, and learn, from work-at-home entrepreneurs that share a tip as well as their service.
results.name: Work-At-Home Lifestyles

results.description: Consciousness Hacking is a hands-on approach to tools for self-exploration, in order to change the way we think, feel, and live—as individuals and together. Science increasingly recognizes something that’s been the very substrate of spiritual and religious traditions for thousands of years: Through focused self-awareness, we can fundamentally change our conscious experience. Consciousness Hacking NYC meet ups focus on tools, technologies & praxis—like apps, tools, projects, technologies, objects, molecules, and sense-oriented experiences. Our goal is to ferment and inspire a field of cross-pollination and creative ideas regarding consciousness from a robust variety of domains, communities, expertise and interests. Looking for colleagues and collaborators? Let’s share our projects and support new ideas! (Think more along the DIY of the Makers-movement, and less about philosophy or theory!) Cybernetic theory—which holds that the mind and body can be hacked through a range of spiritual techniques and scientific technologies—serves as one key source of inspiration. Consciousness Hacking takes a similarly holistic approach to changing the world through individual self-realization and transformation, an inside out perspective on how technology can serve us by changing our relationship to the world, rather than the world itself.
results.name: Consciousness Hacking NYC

results.description: The Idlewild Park Preservation Committee is a committee of the Eastern Queens Alliance, Inc, a federation of civic associations in Southeast Queens. It is a stewardship group dedicated to the preservation, development and maintenance of Idlewild Park Preserve, a 346 acre wetland area in the Brookville, Rosedale and Springfield Gardens Communities. The wetlands in the park constitute the headwaters to Jamaica Bay. The park is a valuable intertidal saltmarsh. The committee plans activities, events and effective methods to implement the committee's strategic action plan.  To learn more about our efforts go to the Idlewild tab at www.easternqueensalliance.org.

results.description:
WELCOME!!! TO THE ORIGINAL BRONX DESIGN MEETUP GROUP

About The Organizer:

Hi! My Name is Monica Liu. I started an online Art and Design service named Mon Liu Designs and Art Studio. I run a guest house in The Bronx for traveling artists and professionals who comes from all over the world, currently looking to expand our studios into Queens, hoping to break in to NYC soon. I graduated at The New York School of Interior Design, and an ongoing Student Artist at the Art Student League of New York. I am also a mother of a very open hearted toddler boy. I have covered a variety of mediums: Mix Media Art, Fiber Art, Paper Art and Origami, Painting, Drawing, Set and stage design, Photography and Filmmaking, Economical Friendly Art Installations, Murals, Technical Drafting, Interior Design, Computer-Aid-Design and Architecture.

My interest in building a group is:

1. To meet Designers and Artists where we can all exchange and learn from each others work.

2. To create a meditative space where we can create our work.

3. I make sure part of my meetups are dedicated to parents with small children who never had the chance to get to know the passion inside of themselves and hoping they can find a space here to create artistically.

4. I am a lover of traveling so I love to hear and share stories from people that come from other countries and go to visit the country myself to learn about different cultures.

If What you are looking for is 3 or more of the above, You are encouraged to join! We are all about creating a positive lifestyle with arts and retreats.

About The Group:

We are CREATIVE DESIGNERS who are not just about pick and choose materials for a space but also working creatively on making a space, indoor or out, into creative spaces such as customized ceiling murals, economical-friendly Installations/ Visual Displays.

Do you ever wonder how to get a project started? or have you gotten in the middle of a project and needed someone to give you a nudge to help you thinking outside the box so you can see the project at a new perspective? How about brainstorming with collages, or coming up with a design pattern for a partition wall? How do I achieve that result?  I am here to help you spark that creativity within you. 

It sounds fantastic, and we need pure confidence. Knowing that we can make something seems impossible at times when we are so caught up in our lives. SO here I am, working on the creative person in me, I want to create a group to come together with those who are at a creative block at times like myself, we all need some inspiration. We all have build-up on creativity when we dont use it, We're are all talented with something.

Whether you are at beginning level, Graduated or an Emerging Professional who did, or learning all aspects of design or getting creative with art projects, me and others are here to encourage you to get that project started and accomplished! To be sure that you get the practice with sufficient hands on experience.

We are based in the Bronx, but we will be holding some meet ups in New York City, go to shows & events, design shops and workshops as we learn to do artistic things like drawing, painting and the process of making something creative. Depending on the experience of our Design Enthusiasts available, we hope to put together some hands-on real projects experiences and tailor meet ups according to our members, so be sure to let us know what you hope to achieve with us.

Be sure to check out our group pages at the top panel, as we will consistently update inspirational websites of Art and Design Trends. Also, come back check out our calendar even when there are no meetup scheduled, we could be meeting up with other interior design group events in the city. If you have something in mind, be sure to let us know what you like to see and achieve at an upcoming meetup and we will surely do our best to tailor our meetups to the best of our group member's interest.

Join us Now!

To get to know me and my company, please stay tune and find me on Pinterest and Facebook and the following links:

Pinterest.com/monliudesigns

Mon Liu Designs Gallery & Inspirations   https://www.facebook.com/groups/155577364485769/

results.description:
Think of this as a gym — or better yet a playground — for the spirit! We'll use guided meditation, creative visualization and improvisation games to learn to be present, stimulate our limitless imaginations and intuitive abilities, and align our thoughts and actions with the voice of unconditional love.

Philosophically, we'll be drawing on principles of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) as well as the teachings of Shakti Gawain, Eckhart Tolle, Barry Neil Kaufman, improv guru Keith Johnstone, and others. Familiarity with the Course or experience with meditation or improvisation is not required. All that is required is a sense of curiosity and a willingness to explore and play!

Instructor Christopher Pelham is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. He has previously also worked in educational publishing and as a web designer, writer/editor, actor (most notably for several seasons with Doris Duke Impact Award Winner Johnny Simons at the Hip Pocket Theatre in Ft. Worth, TX and with artists Richard Bach, Harold Lehmann, and Lake Simons in NYC), producer and videographer. He graduated from Duke University in 1991 with a degree in English (20th century and post-colonial literature). In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox.

Another great way to get a taste of this approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events based on ACIM, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!

Let's drink and dine in the loveliest neighborhood in the best city in the world.  In the unlikely event we exhaust choices in the West Village, we may consider exploring other areas too.

By joining and/or remaining in this group, you acknowledge and agree that out of courtesy to your fellow Bon Vivants, the organizer, and all of humanity:  

(1) lateness to meals may cost you the ability to join, in the establishment's and/or the organizer's discretion; 

(2) for seated meals, current etiquette requires a standard tip of (at least) 20%, and so, together with tip, all attendees will pay for what they order plus 30%; 

(3) for drinking at bars, current etiquette requires a standard tip of (at least) $2 per drink; 

(4) "foodie talk" is forbidden - it's deadly boring, this is no longer 2008, and you won't do it; and 

(5) the organizer has the right to remove members for noncompliance with any of the foregoing, for any other reason, or for no reason at all, because organizing costs time and money, and the organizer's expenditure of those things earns that right.

With apologies to those to whom it does not apply -- the organizer wishes the above went without saying, but experience has shown it cannot.
results.name: West Village Bon Vivants

results.description: FuckUp Nights is a global movement that celebrates the fuck ups that take places when building new things in business, art and science. topics.name: Music Teachers Talking about Teaching Music

results.description: For anyone with a 21st century view of music education... spiritual meets 'business mind' outlook. We want to avoid competitive training and promote co-operative collaboration and mutual support. Our desire is to be quite unique...to be VERY different than the stereotype that music educators often seem to portray. Check out (info@beyondrock.org) (facebook.com/beyondrockcamp). That 2-4 week summer program is a model of something 'truly' unique. We desire a year round expansion of that program...this is our ultimate goal... classes, lessons, diverse workshops, showcases, etc.  Anyone who wants to serve kids/teens with teaching and coaching rock/pop/alternative/hip-hop/etc. music (as primary) but ALSO in various other areas... conflict resolution, acceptance of new ideas, theater improv therapy (through theater games), yoga, an array of creative activities and community and confidence reinforcement. Helping kids/teens "step outside their comfort zones" with no fear of judgement. The teaching is one thing and takes exceptional people... still, it's the skilled, strategic, pro-active, organization, directorship and management part that is the really tough part.  It takes the combination of educator, humanitarian and entrepreneur to implement such a mission. With all participants from administration to volunteers to equipment setup to instructors...we absolutely prefer the concept of the 'work WITH' mentality...we're not all that fond of the term 'work FOR'. A socialistic, democratic angle to building a company...perhaps...but it seems to work amazingly well with Beyond Rock. A feeling of ownership is essential to develop passion in an individual. That said, obviously there still needs to be an agreement on philosophy and mission and those individuals who thoughtfully plan & guide - leading the course of events. They need to be sharp, very pro-active, extraordinarily communicative (staff, parents, students) and decisive.
results.name: Business Entrepreneurs With Music Education in Mind

There are not a lot of safe spaces for nonbinary/gender variant individuals to meet and socialize, so we've taken the liberty of creating one in NYC. The goal of this group is to allow for trans folk (including those who don't solely identify as male or female, and those who don't identify as either) to meet, connect, and form lasting friendships. There will be no gender policing here and you are free to express yourself, as yourself, in our company! 

If you are cisgender, please do not join this group. It is not your educational resource, nor is it a space for allies. It is solely for trans-identifying individuals to have a space free of questioning, judgment, or danger.

========================================================

Hello Telugu folks,

Surprised to know that there is no telugu group for people living in NJ/NY inspite of being in large numbers. This meetup group is for all telugu people living in NY/NJ who love to hangout with fellow telugu people in and around New York City.

The idea is to have best of both the worlds, all the incredible things about India in addition to the beautiful varied culture and international experience that New York can offer! We want it all! The main agenda is to arrange plenty of activities to socialize and mingle with like minded people over evening drinks, dinners and movies.

We love Telugu Movies and the buzz around our premier shows. We love Bollywood nights and can dance all night long. We love hanging out in happy hours. We love roaming around the city, planning day trips and adventure activities. We love Hyderabadi Biryani, Spicy food , potlucks and all our festivals. We love Cricket.

People with similar interests go ahead and join the meetup. We want this to be perfect meeting place be it for socialize/social networking or for somebody who wants to enjoy a weekend beyond just plain dining at some Indian restaurant.

Members are welcome to bring their non-Telugu speaking friends/partners to events.

Note: This is not dating meetup. The core of the group is genuinely cool, cultured & super liberal without any hidden agenda or judgement and we seek the same in you!

========================================================

1. Please try to give at least 24 hour notice if you need to change your RSVP as a courtesy to the host and other girls attending. Every so often, a last minute change is okay, we know sometimes things happen but still please give a heads up, as you would with any friend. Those that habitually flake will be removed from the group to keep the quality of people and attendance high.

Organizing Events:

Tips on how to make the most of this group: 

Attend Events!

Be an Event Organizer - It is also nice to support to girls who attend your events  by attending theirs if they are also organizers.

Reach out and say Hi - It's highly encouraged to reach out to me and or   other members if just want to say hi, introduce yourself or think you might have something in common! Don't be shy! 


Looking forward to enjoying the city with everyone! 

Cheers!

topics.name: Healing with past life regression and hypnotherapy

results.description:
Hi NYC Goddesses!

Are you ready to Awaken Your Authentic Self? Women all over the world are waking up to a new renaissance of the heart, soul and body, reclaiming her inner voice and taking steps towards freedom.

For the last five years I have been repairing my relationship with my mental, emotional, physical and spiritual bodies. I overcame breast cancer and had to take a really hard look at all the emotional toxins and mindset I was carrying around from my relationship with my parents and then men, I was acting out subconsciously, seeking love from a pain point. My wounds were speaking louder than my heart, they began to show me how unhappy I was. Fast forward five years to today. Today I travel and teach throughout North America sharing with women Soul Therapy Seminars and a Journey to Self Love, a two day emotionally empowering discovery of learning how to love yourself, honestly, courageously and with joy. I know you have been yearning to share with a group of women who have your back, seeking support from others who can understand your own journey, acknowledging your pain while uplifting you to greater new heights of self awareness. You've been ready for a long time now, searching and seeking your own journey to self love. I've been there, let me help guide you along the way so that you can get there with the support that you need to accelerate your life to one of freedom and inner peace. I am grateful to be able to share with you all that I have learned on my own journey to self love! 

Join me in this powerful group of women as we explore self love, while learning how to connect deeply to your authentic self, the part of you that is desiring to live a powerfully expressed life. There is that small voice that wants to be heard, understood, acknowledged and loved, that part is your authentic self: your soul.

Blessings,

Carolyn Goldfarb, Licensed Soul Therapist, Spiritual Healer & Guide

Testimonials:

*** I had the pleasure of taking Carolyn's "A Journey To Self Love" group class and it was amazing! 732-828-6900

The Breakfast Club NJ - 10 Points for Good Member Citizenship

1) Attend meetings regularly to keep group strong and help pay back to others (meeting logistics on our website www.thebreakfastclubnj.com)

2) Keep anti-virus on your machine up to date and run scan regularly

3) Review messages and if request for assistance please help whenever possible

4) Join groups linked in group and connect to other members directly (questions see Gerry Peyton)

5) Join groups Facebook group and Google+ group and connect to other members directly (questions see Adrienne Roman)

6) Join groups twitter account (questions see George Pace)

7) If you run across someone in transition invite them to join our group and sponsor them through process (details on our website www.thebreakfastclubnj.com)

8) Sunday mornings listen to our radio show, "Your Career Is Calling", at 8am ET either on radio at 107.7 or via internet 24/7 live or on demand at www.1077thebronc.com (as this is a call in show your calls help make it successful)

9) If you are in transition put your elevator pitch in writing to group, ask for help with job search issues or connecting to people at target companies, regularly post job opportunities (from email you joined the group - send email to thebreakfastclubnj@yahoogroups.com)

10) Help fellow members whenever possible

Information on “The Breakfast Club NJ”: (www.thebreakfastclubnj.com)
There is information below on the location, other information, etc.
Go to http://www.thebreakfastclubnj.com/ for more information and how to join the Yahoo group. You can join the yahoo group at any time; you do not need to have attended a meeting. You can also attend meetings at any time without having joined the yahoo group.
If you have any questions, please let me know (brian.mecca@yahoo.com) or send an email to Info@thebreakfastclubnj.com
We look forward to seeing everyone let's make this a great meeting for our members that are in transition and welcome those that have landed

Meeting Format:
7:30 to 8:00 – Registration & Open Networking
8:00 to 8:15 - Welcome and housekeeping
8:15 to 9:15 – Presentation by the guest speaker – Limited to 60 minutes
9:15 to 10:15 - Elevator Pitch - 30 Seconds about yourself, who you are, what you are looking for, target companies (3-4), how we can help you, how you can help others. Follow the rule of the Three B’s of Public Speaking: Be informative; Be brief; Be seated.
10:15 until you choose to leave - Open Networking, follow up with people you are interested in meeting following their elevator pitch, exchange business cards, peruse the library, arrange follow up meetings, etc.
1 - Make sure you come with the 30 second elevator pitch - honed - including your targeted companies, your value proposition, etc.
2 - If you are not already a member of our linked in and Facebook groups please join
3 - Once linked to our groups - link to each other - a strong network is a vital component to a successful job search
4 - If you are a member and new to transition send a brief message to the group (from the email you joined the breakfast club from) thebreakfastclubnj@yahoogroups.com introducing yourself - and what companies you are targeting - we have 2500+ members that will respond with help where they can
results.name: The Breakfast Club NJ

results.description:
Columbia University Buddhist Association

The Columbia University Buddhist Association (CUBA) seeks to provide Columbia students and friends with the opportunity to meet regularly in a supportive group setting to practice meditation, discuss Buddhism, and develop friendships. There is a profound need for all of us to maintain a balance between the mind and the body. We believe we can help all Columbia students and friends in the following ways:

 - Deal with stress and other negative states of mind in a productive manner
 - Learn about our negative states of mind through the lens of Buddhist teachings and practices
 - Foster compassion, loving joy, and equanimity in our daily lives

The Columbia Buddhist Association is a student organization that offers Columbia students and friends the opportunity to learn practical techniques for self improvement. The Sangha practices meditation to better manage their negative states of mind (such as anger, stress, and fear). By doing so, participants enhance their ability to remain focused, relaxed, and clear-minded when confronted with difficult or stressful situations.

Although the Columbia Buddhist Association will utilize Buddhist teachings, we are not a religious group in the sense of wanting individuals to convert to Buddhism. Additionally, we do not have support from a specific Buddhist temple. Instead, we have teachers who come from Japanese, Chinese, Indian, Tibetan, even Western traditions. We hope to support the entire Columbia University community and friends in being more reflective and compassionate in our daily lives; we truly believe that this will foster a more equitable and just society!

By the way, no need for cushions. Just bring yourself!
results.name: Columbia University Buddhist Association

results.description:
This group is about your relationship with your husband… come see how you can better a good relationship or fix a broken one!

I am a life coach, soccer coach and former restaurant owner! I believe growing up in the restaurant business, playing soccer and coaching for 30 years has been a great foundation for my working with people and their relationships. Life coaching…especially in the areas of relationships has come easy to me. It is very near and dear to my heart. Why? Because I’ve BEEN THERE. And if it weren’t for the people who came out of the woodwork to help me, I wouldn’t be here to help YOU!

I have been married 25 years… have 6 almost grown kids… love my husband more than anything in the world and we were separated for 3 years at one point too!!! Wow! We have lived through interstate moves, many job changes, deaths that were close to us, crazy insane families, depression, grief, anxiety, anger, surgeries, major financial troubles… and with those 6 kids- 4 of them were in college at once! 

So come join me in exploring what marriage is really all about!

Dorina 
(meetups will vary in cost depending on what we are doing but will average around $25)

results.description:
We are an informal group of adult video gamers, who have been playing online video games together, consistently for over 15 years. While we are primarily East Coast, Brooklyn based gamers, our online community contains gamers who we regularly play with across many different States (Utah, Colorado, New Orleans, Massachusetts... etc), across many different platforms and games. We also keep in contact with one another across many different mediums, such as facebook, skype, internet forums, and regular text. As gamers we are all adults, with full-time jobs, some with families, and/or pursing further schooling. As a result, our atmosphere is drama-free, friendly, and mature. Who has time for drama when you have work in the morning? Ages 21+ is our preferred atmosphere. We enjoy online gaming not just as a hobby, but also a means to foster communities and build friendships. Many of us, are not just fellow gamers who share in a hobby, but are also real life friends. Many of those friendships were formed within different online gaming communities across the decade. We hope our meetup group will continue to build these types of positive relationships created by gaming. As a gaming group, we are an eclectic group with different tastes who all consider online gaming a hobby. Many of us are both casual and hardcore online gamers, with roots also stemming in tabletop and collectible card games (MTG, Yu-Gi-Oh, Versus, Pokemon, D&D... etc).

We are currently engaged in Destiny for the Playstation 4 and Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn across multiple platforms and are actively recruiting. While online guilds and clans are a-plenty, our group likes to know who we're playing with. If you're interested in joining our local online gaming community and our other extended online gaming community, we tend to meet-up at different places in Brooklyn and NYC.

In addition, think of our meetup as a way to meet new people who might be playing other online games as well. We hope this is an opportunity to form brand new communities, organic, specifically to meetup. Take the opportunity to meet new people and see what types of games they play. It's a great opportunity to find similar ground in similar games, to build relationships in-game and as well as in real life.

Typically we meet at Xe May Sandwich Shop: 96 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10009. We can be emailed at brooklynlegend718@gmail.com
results.name: Brooklyn Legend - New York Based Online Gaming Community
