We're all on a mission to create and inspire. Some are published, some are not, most are trying to finish a project and others just want to get back in the habit of writing. Some of us write for a living, many don't. We are all working towards a creative goal and all are welcome! <br>

Each session centers on a specific topic. We discuss and write on that topic through different writing prompts, works and activities. Workshop presentation is limited to under 10 minutes, depending on how many people sign up. We have a website (www.nywritingclub.com), social media (Twitter:@nywritingclub) (IG: @nywritingclub) and a Facebook group (www.facebook.com/groups/newyorkwritingclub/) where members will be able to post information regarding their events, projects, ask questions and make comments. Check out

We meet every two weeks, usually at the same location, on a Saturday around 2pm. We also go out for food and drinks after our meetings as well. To get a feel for who we are and what we're about, read a description of one of our past meetups.

If you appreciate writing and expressing yourself, why not come share it with us. Let's gain inspiration and inspire each other at the same time!

"Writing means sharing. It's part of the human condition to want to share things - thoughts, ideas, opinions." --Paulo Coelho

<br>

Great ambiance and diverse people, experience NYC like no other with Hotchillies entertainment.

But no longer! We're going to be able to talk about "Wicked" and "Hamilton" with our friends and actually know what they're talking about. And bonus! We're going to impress our in-laws when they come to town because we got them Broadway tickets. And BEST OF ALL - we're going to make other theatre geek friends!

results.description:
Our intention is to bring together people at the nexus of consciousness-raising, social entrepreneurship and social change to network and to spotlight individuals, projects, movements, NGO's, and for-good companies that are extending love and creativity into the world in ways that inspire others to do the same. We will attempt to bring a spiritual perspective to themes such as environmentalism, sustainability, human rights, economic justice and women's empowerment. From the point of view of spirit, "nothing real can be threatened" [A Course in Miracles]. From this perspective, it is madness to try to change anyone or anything; however, this conclusion hardly precludes action! Once freed from the need to change ourselves or others, we can devote all our thoughts to sharing our love and creativity, and there are an infinite variety of ways we can be kind and helpful to one another. In fact, it is only through sharing our inner creativity and unconditional love that we remember and realize our limitlessness.

To this end we envision hosting documentary film screenings, mixers, lectures, fundraisers, panel discussions, Q&As, and, perhaps later, organizing and/or participating in various social good projects. We value diversity and inclusivity and invite you to share your voice with the community.
results.name: Spirituality & Social Change Meetup

We put together Live Music Concerts periodically where the group can meet and greet to make real lasting connections. Join this community if you're someone who seek support in what you're doing and are willing give support as well to other members of this community. You're encouraged to live with passion, do the things that bring you joy and give you a sense of purpose and fulfillment, think positively all the times.


In this group you will also receive

• Support in various forms 

• Encouragement & inspiration to keep your head up and moving forward

• New friends & a community to grow with 

• Advice to help you make better decisions in your journey of life


Enjoy Life it's not just a saying it's a way of life. Be free from worry my friend. 

"Alone we beg. Together we make demands."

Smax Music

www.smaxmusic.com

results.description:
After joining multiple Meetups and meeting people in everyday situations, I have confirmed that the life of an Introvert isn't easy. For those of us who are outgoing, we may attract those who don't quite understand us, leaving them feeling like we are not interested in establishing (or maintaining) friendships, or that we dislike people. This is normally not the truth for most Introverts. Many of us desire and want meaningful friendships but our dominant need to be in our own, undisrupted thoughts sometimes get in the way.

This Meetup is for Introverts (and those who can or want to understand us) who want to meet new people (and possibly establish some meaningful friendships), mingle, and partake in social activities.

Free Myers Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) Test: http://www.humanmetrics.com/cgi-win/jtypes2.asp

results.description:
The Challenge

You’re expecting twins or your twins are 0-6months! You have a million questions and you don’t know where to start. Plus you have no idea who to talk to. You need some answers and you need a support system to get you through it.

The Solution

Twin Love Concierge’s New York & Connecticut Expecting Twins Classes, Postnatal services and Twins & Sleep classes help connect you with other twin parents in your local area while answering all of the twin questions you would like answered. We combining the two essentials all new twin parents need – support and experience. Our twin experts educate you on all the key topics surrounding twin parenthood and allow you to enjoy the babies and not feel overwhelmed.

The classes span Manhattan, Brooklyn, Westchester, Greenwich and Long Island.

For full details on topics we cover, locations, times and the most up to date twin information see - www.twinloveconcierge.com

results.description: Have a really bright kid with learning and/or social challenges? Twice exceptionally gifted kids may experience school-based issues, difficulty finding and forming meaningful peer relationships and managing challenges at home. Parents' needs are often as unique as their children's in finding solutions for school and home related issues, and finding an understanding peer group to share strengths and struggles with in a safe and nonjudgmental environment. As a consultant, licensed clinical therapist, and the parent of a young adult who is gifted and has struggled in traditional school settings, I am hosting monthly gatherings for parents of twice exceptionally gifted children and adolescents. If you think that you have a twice exceptional child, but aren't sure, feel free to contact me.

If you are planning to run Paris 2015 Marathon and want to meet others, who are planning to do the same, please join the group and let's get ready for this wonderful event together.
results.name: New York Marathon Meetup for Paris 39th 2015 Marathon

results.description:
Brooklyn Breathwork is a monthly gathering that honors the sacred gift of life through the gentle and transformative modality of rebirthing breathwork. We also host special evenings with lightworkers and healers. We are here to create a conscious, sacred and supportive community in the heart of one of the greatest cities in the world. Breathe on with love! Unless otherwise noted, every group breathe and Brooklyn Breathwork event costs $25.

Rebirthing Breathwork, also commonly referred to as rebirthing or conscious connected breathing, is an acceleration of the healing process through an exploration and practice of the breath. Bypassing the mind entirely, the rebirthing breath goes deep into your cells, saturating the body with both oxygen and life force, and helps to release any negative self-thought, perceived limitations, past trauma or any uncomfortable feelings that are held in the body. It is a truly transformational modality that helps the breather recognize their union with their higher self and all of life with peace and absolute love.
results.name: Brooklyn Breathwork

results.description:
Our Meetup Purpose: This is a group for mature Myers-Briggs "iNtuitive Feelers" (NF) who want to meet other intuitive feelers for deeper and more intimate conversations and connections.  Approximately one in ten people fit the NF personality profile.  If you are not sure if you fit the profile, click "Pages" up above, and click on the free test link to take a personality test.  

Our group of NFs will favor positive, uplifting, and inspiring conversations amongst those of us over 30 years old.  It will be a supportive environment where we can learn and grow. I believe that we "idealists" have the most amazing potential to do good in our society. Let's SUPPORT one another in our dreams, our goals, and investing our amazing potential back into our families, our society, and in our world!


What Wikipedia says about us:  "As the identity-seeking temperament, Idealists long for meaningful communication and relationships. They search for profound truths hidden beneath the surface, often expressing themselves in metaphor. Focused on the future, they are enthusiastic about possibilities, and they continually strive for self-renewal and personal growth.

Idealists strive to discover who they are and how they can become their best possible self -- always this quest for self-knowledge and self-improvement drives their imagination - and Idealists yearn to help others make the journey too."
results.name: NYC Idealists - NF (INFP, INFJ, ENFP, ENFJ) meetup (Age 30+)

This is a great bargain because each practica costs $12/person and you're getting a mini-private-lesson and lots of nice people to practice with, snacks, great music, beautiful dance floor. Racing Club Practica meets every Thursday 9 pm to 12:00 am and Rawson Practica meets every Saturday 2 to 5 pm at Stepping Out Studios, 37 W 26th Street, 9th floor. Rebecca also offers a full program of classes and lessons, and you can read more about those at rebeccatango.com. But this Meetup group is all about practicing at whatever skill level you are currently enjoying, and getting ready to go out to milongas and simply dance, express the music, connect with a partner, and have some intense fun!

We'll meet to discuss this "phenomenon" and how it relates to relaxation, tingles, sleep, anxiety, depression, scientific research, current culture, internet trends, and anything else you'd like to talk about. results.description:
Whether it's finding a job you love, fixing your relationship, losing 30 pounds or simply being ready for the next exciting chapter in life, the work you do at HG provides immediate inspiration, serious results and lasting knowledge.

Our Life Coaches utilize the Handel Method, which is also the foundation of the work we do in companies such as BASF, The New York Times and Vogue as well as the classes we teach at MIT, NYU and Stanford.

Together we dig deep, play big and don’t stop until goals are fulfilled and lessons learned. We care, we love what we do and we walk our talk.


The Handel Method®

The Handel Method® was created by Handel Group® co-founder Lauren Zander over the past 15 years. The method is the foundation for courses we teach at institutions such as MIT, NYU and Stanford, the work we do within companies such as AOL, BASF, Sony, BP, and The New York Times, and the coaching that we provide to individuals. The method is revolutionary yet easy to understand, methodical yet customizable. The Handel Method® is based on a belief in the power of speaking the truth, and in Personal Integrity® as the most direct avenue toward creating permanent change in any area of life. We work with clients to address their fears, thoughts, and negative beliefs so that they are free to invent a life they love.


For more information on the Handel Group, please visit

http://handelgroup.com

topics.name: Practicing the early stages of Argentine Tango

results.description:
Welcome at Ultimate Tango!

Here you find all you need to become a true member of Tango community. We focus on developing in you the truth understanding of what Tango is.

Tango is not just a dance. It’s philosophy, the way of comprehending the world, the way of building relationships, the way to understand yourself.

Here at Ultimate Tango we teach you the tango alphabet, we teach you how to create words, we teach you basic rules, basic steps, basic combinations. We teach you all you need to know about music, connection, lead and follow, types of tangos and more. From there you can launch onto your own journey to discover what Tango means for you. 

We don’t want to limit you with multitude of steps and clatter your memory with combinations you can never remember. Our goal is to give you the true understanding of Tango structure and music, mechanics of the movement, technique and cadence. From there you can start improvising on you own. Find your own style.

We offer carefully structured courses in Tango, Vals and Milonga at 3 different levels – beginner, intermediate, advanced at 3 different locations: New York City NY, West New York NJ and Boston MA. We also offer workshops to address more specialized topics. Private lessons are available for those who wish to progress at their own pace.

DON'T REPEAT MINDLESSLY. LEARN THROUGH UNDERSTANDING.
results.name: Ultimate Tango NYC Meetup

results.description:
Sorry for this group being in "Private" setting.  We value members' privacy.  I'm sure you wouldn't expect anything less!  

These days in New York City, we have seen some dramatic increase in number of AM/WF couple and more AM/WF couples have placed wedding notices in New York Times. Yet, when this Meetup group was originally formed in early 2012, aside from us, there were NO Meetup that specifically supports AM/WF couple or singles who are interested in getting into AM/WF relationship. Through various activities such as brunch, dinner, movie, party,discussions or other outdoor activities, we hope this group, as a pioneer in this niche group, will aspire more people to be a part of this specific community or be open to this type of relationship.

IMPORTANT NOTE: In ongoing efforts to balance AM/WF ratio, if you are AM, there MIGHT be a wait before approval. WF will be approved rather quickly, unless we feel that she wouldn't be able to find any match in this group. This waitlist is not necessarily a first come, first serve.

Couples are welcomed, as long as they are AM/WF couple. Please reference each other when you "apply". Thanks.

results.description:
Welcome to the Central NJ chapter of Teach and Learn Networking!

Events - Community - Consulting

Entrepreneurs, business professionals, we know how you feel about networking. It sucks. Unless there's free wine involved, walking up to strangers and talking about work (after you've worked all day) sounds like torture.

Does a professional networking event have to feel like a middle school dance? No.

Teach and Learn Networking believes in curating environments where sharing ideas, resources, and network power feels natural. 

How do we do that?

Good question. Conversation and education.

You'll participate in facilitated networking activities (a fancy word for ice breakers) to get the conversation flowing with the most electric entrepreneurs, biz professionals, c-suite execs, and startups in our area. We know that honing your skill set is essential to your $uccess, so our speakers focus on teaching, not selling. 

What are people saying about us? Check out some testimonials here, or scroll back through our past events and check the comments. 

We also provide private consulting and management services for businesses looking to amplify their message with events! Contact us for more info.

Our newsletter (coming Jan 2016!) and membership to our group is free. If you’d like to sponsor, do a giveaway, or be a vendor at an upcoming event, contact Sam Popp at samanthaepopp@gmail.com

www.tandlnetworking.com

Join a circle chat or just hang around. results.description:
Greetings Heroes,

Welcome to our official home on meetup.com! eSports Heroes is a global organization of gamers who care deeply about the growing world of electronic sports. Over the last decade, online gaming has become a staple of modern life. Thus, professional gaming has exploded in popularity and is now the fastest growing entertainment genre among young adults globally. The world of eSports is an uncharted, untapped frontier from which we can establish ourselves as early adopters.

eSports Heroes of NYC is the original ESH chapter. We are an ambitious group of like minded entrepreneurs who care deeply about the advancement of this industry and will help spearhead this movement to make eSports synonymous with sports. 

If you are interested in making new friends, forging professional relationships, and becoming part of this growing industry feel free to join. 

Currently supported games include:  Hearthstone - Starcraft 2 - Overwatch - Heroes of the Storm - Counter Strike - Call of Duty - Dota 2 - League of Legends - Super Smash Bros

Members are eligible for the following meetups: Tournaments / LAN Events - Hearthstone Fireside Gatherings - Industry Trade Shows - Meet the Pros - Pro Gaming Workshops - Impromptu Gaming Sessions  - Domestic / International Field Trips - Food & Fellowship. 

Potential ESH sponsorship are available to gamers who show exceptional skill or dedication to their craft.

If you are interested in founding your own eSports Heroes chapter we have developed the infrastructure to support you. Please fill out an application on our website: eSports Hero

Hello cinephiles!  If you love movies, eating and talking....our meetup is for you! We have a nice group of people where everyone is friendly and no one is left out. At our events, we end up with great discussions and lots of laughs. I decided to start my own meet up after attending many that were not inclusive or friendly.  I am a movie obsessed woman living in North NJ. I adore great films and even more, sharing my opinions, hearing other's opinions and having lively discussions about movies. I would love to gather together other movie buffs to see movies in a theater and then do brunch, lunch or dinners where we talk about the film and just have fun. Everyone is welcome, the only thing you need is a love of movies, an opinion to share and a sense of humor! This meet up will take suggestions and opinions for movies and places to eat. I would say if you live in North NJ in Bergen, Essex or Hudson County that would be convenient. See you at the movies!

Note: I appreciate yearly dues of $5.00 which are given to me at first meetup.

If you RSVP and do not show up and do not notify us, you will be removed. Sometimes we have reservations so we need an accurate head count. Also, please let us know if you cannot come so we don't end up waiting for you at the theater.

Looking forward to meeting you!

results.description:
About Team In Training

Our athletes have walked away with new friends, amazing accomplishments and the sense that they did something even more important than getting in good shape. How serious is blood cancer? Every three minutes, someone new is diagnosed with blood cancer. Every 10 minutes, someone dies. In exchange for training and support, you help raise money towards cures for blood cancers leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin’s disease and myeloma -- the No. 1 disease killer of children is leukemia.

The Reason Why

• Coaching and training. Travel to a major marathon, half marathon, century, hiking adventure or triathlon in exciting locations.

• The opportunity to make your athletic goals a reality (an unbeatable offer with great personal rewards).

• A connection with an honored patient so you know just who and what you’re doing it all for.

As the largest endurance sports training program in the world, we will provide you with the experience of a lifetime.

Events 

If you’ve ever wanted to run, walk, or run/walk 26.2, 13.1, or 6.2 miles, now is your chance to join the TEAM that is saving lives. Visit our website at http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/ for a current listing of our Fall and Winter season events.

Contact

Please contact Margo Cianchetta at margarita.cianchetta@lls.org or 908.956.6628, or visit http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/ for more information.

GO TEAM!
results.name: Get Fit, Have Fun, and Help Cure Cancer!

results.description:
Looking to spend more time in Bay Ridge? I am, having returned to Brooklyn after a decade in Queens! Perhaps, like me, you do a lot in Manhattan, but wish you could also just hang around the neighborhood with new friends. We  brunch, lunch, and dine in various restaurants in Bay Ridge, as well as go to local community-building events, like concerts and fairs. While the focus is here in Bay Ridge, we venture off to venues in other parts of Brooklyn, like the Brooklyn Museum and the Heights Players. Membership is NOT limited to only those living in Bay Ridge or even Brooklyn, so those "out on the island" or in one of the other boroughs are welcome, too!

Similar to most meetups, "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors" has a modest $1 organizing fee per event, payable to me at the start of an event, to offset the subscription cost of maintaining the meetup.

Please note our No-Show Policy: Because we've been kept waiting in lobbies, etc., for folks who didn't bother to change their rsvps, "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors"  has a "no-show" policy where any member who incurs ONE no-show with no explanatory emails to me will be permanently removed from our membership rolls and not be allowed to rsvp for any more of our events. After all, would you keep a "friend" who stood you up and never apologized? Let's all respect each other's time and enjoy ourselves with a minimum of discomfort.

Like what you see about "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors "? Then consider joining our sister groups, "Great Places in Gotham" (http://www.meetup.com/The-Great-Places-in-Gotham-Meetup/) , which focuses primarily on Manhattan events and museums, and "Friendly Native New Yorker Walking Tours" (http://www.meetup.com/Friendly-Native-New-Yorker-Walking-Tours/), where as a licensed NYC tour guide, I lead various walking tours in Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens!
results.name: The (Mostly!) Bay Ridge Neighbors Meetup

results.description:
This is not a sit around group, this is trial by fire. If you want to get involved in video production, and are an adult of sound mind and body this may be for you. We meet to voluntarily exchange media and production work.

The rules:

RULE #1: You are not a participant, you are a reporter of the news, you do not place your self in danger, you do not place others in danger, you do not personally comment on situations or editorialize, you cover others at the event talking. They are the subject, not any of us in the meetup.

RULE #2: If you want to make sure what you want get's published, either publish it your self on social media, or, convince someone in the group or outside of the group to publish. Just because you are part of the group, does not mean anyone has any obligation to contribute to your work. This is a loosely based meetup.

RULE #3: Bring your skills. If you like being a reporter, if you want to do audio engineering, if you want to write music with true current social meaning, then this is an opportunity.

RULE #4: Try to share your skills with others, there will always be video to produce, if you want to do video production, audio production, anything in the stream to create a news worthy news piece, this is your opportunity.

RULE #5: Do this because you enjoy it, try to have fun, help others, try make meaning of the chaos.

RULE #6: We attend public meeting using Open Meeting Law, in New Jersey this means you can only video speakers or officials, due to NJ draconian laws the public in a meeting has a 'right to privacy' at a meeting. In New York all present at meeting may be recorded.  Recording can not interfere with an orderly meeting. NOTE: Every meeting will generate media to produce, I will generate it and provide it under Creative Commons, so if you are downstream of Video and Audio capture, don't worry, you will always have at least my work to work with.

I started this group when I found out that out of a city of 6+ million, there was no planned coverage of THE Post Ambrose LNG public hearing in Queens. It does not matter if you are a Conservative, Liberal, Progressive or any other affiliation. If you want to get involved with video production, this is an opportunity. For my personal work, I always publish creative commons, unless I included copy write material granted to me specifically for my production. Musicians and Sound engineers are badly needed.

FYI

BE PREPARED! 

Federal and State hearings for unpopular infrastructure projects happen many times in the dead of winter, on the coldest evening with virtually no public transit access.  When I was at the Queens meeting it was dark and in the teens,  I could not imagine any elderly person or sane person taking a multi-link trip to that location, and saw none waiting at bus stop.

If you want to be on the short list of people to be notified of short notice events, contact me.  I always announce on the website, but sometimes less than 24 hours are given in advance notice.
results.name: (All Volunteer) Independent News Media

results.description:
Food and Drink Adventures is geared towards thirty-somethings who want to explore the culinary and nightlife playground that is New York. More than just a drinking and dining-out group, this group is about learning and experiencing all that we consume--as it relates to culture, heritage, history and so much more! 

A few things to note: 

1) Events: All events will be designed to foster friendship.  Dinners will not have large attendance lists, whereas happy hours will not be capped.  

2) Age: This group is intended for people in their 30's.  I'd appreciate it if you respect that. 

3) In an effort to stem the amount of people who RSVP and fail to show up, I’m going to implement the following policy for any person who RSVPs for the 1st time to an event that has a set reservation number and has not shown up to any past events:

When you RSVP as a 1st Timer, I will send you a message to confirm that you will be attending the event. To confirm, simply respond to my message within 48 hours, and you’ll remain on the RSVP list. In the event I do not hear back from you within those 48 hours, if there’s a wait-list, I will remove you from the RSVP list to have someone from the wait-list take your spot.

So please be sure you have your meetup settings allowing me as organizer to send you messages through meetup directly.

4) Removal: If you’re been a member of the group for six months and haven’t RSVP’d or attended a single event, then I reserve the right to remove you from the group. I know that there are a ton of meetup options for one to partake in this great city, but I hope that if you signed up for this group, you’re genuinely interested in giving it a shot – stop by for a drink at one the the next happy hours, or take a chance and try a new cuisine while meeting some new folks. 

Also, if you've RSVP'd to at least 2 meetups, and fail to show up without changing your RSVP and/or notifying me of your absence, I reserve the right to remove you from the group. C'mon, guys - it takes 2 seconds to change your RSVP and/or notify me - I don't have the patience for flaky people - feel free to join another group that will tolerate such behavior.

5) Fees: I think it's lame that meetup has fees to begin with and hasn't figured out a way to generate revenue without holding Head Organizers liable for such costs, but it is what it is...with that being said, I'm not sure if there will be a nominal fee for meetups at some later point in time - as I just took over for the previous organizer, I'm still trying to figure this out.

If all this sounds good to you, then join us! :)
results.name: Food and Drink Adventures (30s)

results.description: This meetup is for single, Jewish gay men in their 30's, 40's and 50's. Our purpose is simple: to be a place where single Jewish gay men can meet in fun, no-pressure, no non-sense environments so that they can find that special Jewish someone. For too long, too many Jewish gay men ended up dating non-Jewish men because (a) there aren't that many of out there to begin with;  and (b) with gay couples, starting a family and having a "Jewish home," was not as much a priority as for a heterosexual couple. But now that's changing. More gay couples are starting families. We strive to be an alternative to those events around the City where supposedly one can meet gay Jewish men, but which can be a bit clique-ish (and also very expensive). We also limit our membership to men who are ADULTS - we will take men in their early 30's, but our IDEAL range is really mid-to-late-30's, 40's and 50's.

results.description: We all have knowledge and talents to share- so let's get together and teach and learn from each other! This is an opportunity to build a community through a "smorgasbord of knowledge" that we constantly create. The idea is simple: Every two weeks we will meet to experience something led by one of the members of the group. We will each have an opportunity to sign up to teach a topic, lead a workshop, give a lecture or anything in between for up to 45 minutes. This is a chance to try new things and have different experiences that we hope, in turn, will build community. As members of this group we have one goal: to help grow our community of knowledge by sharing of ourselves and of course, have fun in the process! That means simply participating or signing up to lead us in a presentation. Is there anything you've always wanted to try but never did or a way you've wanted to push yourself, or something you love deeply that you wish you did more? Anything can be the theme of your presentation to the group- from a juggling workshop to a lecture on evolution to a story of your travels to origami- what matters is that you bring something to the group that you love and are excited to share. On your assigned presentation week please be sure to come prepared with any materials you might need and of course let the group know if anything should be done in advance. Then  the rest of us will learn, grow, and be enriched....until it's our turn to present and enrich others! And don't forget everyone bring your favorite wine or beer to share with the group for some mingling after the presentation!

topics.name: The Impact of Lyme on your Life

results.description:
" But you look so good?"  Sound familiar?  Lyme disease is one of the "invisible diseases" and often lyme patients suffer consequences of "not looking sick" - jobs are lost, family and friends don't understand, doctors don't believe you or want to treat you, etc., etc. In addition, Lyme Patients often, due to crushing fatigue and pain, find themselves alone and isolated unable to go to work or socialize, which can negatively impact one's ability to recover.

This group is Open to Lyme Disease Patients and Friends and Family of Lyme Patients for the purpose of establishing a community of support and creating a safe venue for sharing experiences, challenges, information and camaraderie.  Located on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, the meetings are facilitated by an acupuncturist, sound healer and experienced meditator, who is also diagnosed with neurological lyme. Sessions will include guided-meditation, group discussion and possibly sound/music therapy.
results.name: NYC Lyme Disease Support Group

results.description:
This is a group consisting of individuals interested in discovering how to walk through various NYC streets and look for how to "read" the streets for interesting architectural and historic facts. As a licensed NYC Tour Guide, I will show you how to detect a specific historic block, and then we'll  determine the reason that block is "historic". We'll them move onto other sites where I'll share some stories you in turn can share with your friends(who aren't lucky enough to have joined the group).

I started this group as I wanted to share my knowledge with New Yorkers(native or new) during my slow winter season when I'm not as busy with foreigners and student groups. Since one  of my hobbies is photography, we'll definitely stop by some spots where you can take "bug eye" or "bird's eye" photos and truly realize how those descriptors came about…In fact, as we walk, you may end up suggesting and sharing with the group a better photo ops that the ones I have planned!

 My goal is for all of us to have fun and take away  lasting memories from our time together exploring New York. An extra  bonus would be if some of you decide to meet again (either in a group setting or just an informal twosome), but there are no guarantees. HOWEVER, at the end of the walk, I plan on enjoying a  a low cost snack in an  indoor public space. I hope you all decide to join me for our "Apres Walk"(i.e. my version of "Apres Ski" fun). Incidentally,  you can either bring something with you or purchase something along the way. 

I'll also be happy to share with you info on some  other upcoming   low cost/freebie events/venues for the coming week. I hope you can also  share some other FREEBIE events info with our group. For example, after a Friday walk in  midtown Manhattan, I can direct you to 2 midtown museums where on  Fridays 1 is FREE and the other is "pay-as-you-wish" night. 



The $15 charge per person is to help cover administrative costs. You still will be getting a tour very similar to  my $250 private tours.

Thank you for becoming a member and I hope you join some  of our tours soon!
results.name: Artful, Fun , NYC Walking/Talking Detective Walkers...

results.description: This is a group for Speech-Language Pathologists. Grad students/ CF's/ Licensed SLP's in the New York area. It's a space where we can gather and discuss caseloads, concerns, and be a means of support for one another. Independent Contractors, especially, have no real sense of working on a team. Our work life doesn't necessarily lend itself to social interactions with co-workers, and usually there aren't other speech therapists in our work space with which we can discuss various concerns/issues/cases. To me, having a community of other professionals doing the same work as you is essential to growing and evolving as a professional.

results.description:
This workshop introduces performing techniques that business professionals can start using to master the “soft” skills that many companies are seeking – creativity, communication, teamwork, leadership and strong interpersonal skills.

Objectives
1. Use performing techniques to improve your charisma and presence.
2. Learn to stretch your comfort zone and manage stage fright. Take risks. Think creatively. Think fast on your feet.
3. Discover how to market yourself to colleges or employers. What makes you unique? Gain new awareness of your public persona.

Details
Each workshop is different and may focus on new skills or build upon previous exercises. We provide a supportive environment for beginners.

The workshop may start out with a guided vocal and physical warm up. The awakening of vocal resonators and energizing the body will make you grounded in any job interview or business presentation.

We may do a series of improvisational acting exercises geared towards getting you out of your comfort zone to create characters, stories and conflict within a scene on the spot. This gears you for being quick on your feet and thinking fast in the work place, and also gets people out of their comfort zone as they create these quirky and extroverted characters.

Other exercises will involve using all these acting tools in a business setting.

For meet up members the price is $20 per class. If you would like unlimited monthly classes for $49, please check out https://bookeo.com/academyonbroadway/signup

For more workshops, check out www.academyonbroadway.com
results.name: Acting Workshop for Personal/Professional Success Meetup

results.description:
We're a group of mobile app developers (iOS and Android), mobile startups, and mobile marketers interested in growing our apps. From organic growth hacking, to paid installs, to deep links and referral systems, we cover all things related to growth. Come hang out with us, listen to some great speakers, and learn from some incredible mobile growth experts. 

Stay up to date with the latest mobile growth tips:

Join The Mobile Growth Community Online | Join us on Facebook | Sign up for the blog | Check out videos from our past events

Mobile Growth Meetups are powered by Branch and Grow.Co.

Branch provides free deep linking technology to mobile app developers and marketers. We're on a mission to help you grow your business through deep linking, and allow users to discover content inside mobile apps. In the last year, Branch has gone from powering deep linking for 6 million users to more than 1 billion users.

Grow.co is a community of growth marketing professionals and brands, comprised of more than 7,000 acquisition and retention-oriented professionals. We serve the community through industry summits, a weekly newsletter, a jobs board, and an online forum.
results.name: Mobile Growth New York

Are you a newly married or recently married Catholic Couple (last 5 years)?  This group is designed with you in mind.  The NYC Newly Married Catholic Couples group is a group of married Catholic New Yorkers who enjoy getting together and getting to know other newlyweds.

When Charles & I got married, we did not have many friends who were married, much less Catholic and married, so we decided to create a Meetup to meet and socialize with other newly married Catholic couples on a monthly (or more frequent) basis.  We will plan get togethers and also spiritual events followed by fellowship for our group.  And, we would love your input on what types of events you would like to see!

Please do  join us--we would be so glad to have you.

Best,
Andrea & Charles

results.description:
For Local female entrepreneurs who want to feed their SOUL and GROW their business!

Your self care does not need to be second when you are growing your business. This group offers creative and spiritual/self care tools to help you feel nourished and balanced while you create your dream life and business.

If you want to use "spiritual" tools like journaling, vision boards, vision books, setting intentions, manifesting routines, affirmations, to help you become more profitable, this group is for you!!

This group offers classes, workshops, networking events and more to help like minded women use spirituality, self-care and creative tools to meet their business goals. 

I am a Spiritual Life + Business Coach and I LOVE to help other women create powerful, profitable, streamlined businesses that reflect their life purpose, passion, gifts and divine service!

All of the meetups are held in my lovely, professional office in Fanwood NJ. Some events are Free and some have a fee. To learn more about me, visit my website www.LauraMadrigano.com  I cannot wait to meet you and learn more about your business!

results.description:
The New York City Chapter of FWD.us is your home for Tech and Politics. It's a place to meet like-minded people, build networks and leadership skills, discuss issues you care about, and take action.

Our FWDMonthly meetups explore different topics at the intersection of tech and politics. Guest speakers share their expertise on the month’s issue. Afterwards, members break into teams to tackle specific challenges. From devising innovative ways to connect constituents to Congress to amplifying compelling local narratives, your efforts help fuel the movement for reform.

FWD.us is a nonprofit advocacy group founded by Mark Zuckerberg and other key leaders in the tech community. Our mission is to mobilize the tech community to advocate for legislation that will keep the American Dream achievable in the 21st Century. Our current priority is Immigration Reform.
results.name: FWD.us New York City Chapter

results.description:
ART/TECH/SALON
GRANT GROUP/PROPOSAL FUNDING
These are a series of monthly trans-disciplinary meetups, social networking, open source coding, installations, fun, performances, discussions, presentations, expressions, and demonstrations in art and technology at various locations and venues over Prosecco and refreshments.  We will come together at venues and will exhibit  individual work in addition to holding a grant and proposal funding workshop using the pivot.cos.com grant database.  With an acute interest in the direction of technology, interactive media, DIY culture, new jobs and services, design, architecture, urbanism, the plastic arts, narrative, performing arts, telematic culture, and the new interactive trans-media vehicles these fast and furious labs aim at a type of DIY show and tell that will allow the practitioners in these fields to enrich their experiences and make contact with like minded, energetic people.  In an attempt to pair off old tech with new tech and arts (and possible social contacts and jobs) we aim at types of hybridity with other scintillating minds.
results.name: ART/TECH SALON

results.description:
About Theology on Tap: Have you ever noticed that sometimes your best and deepest theological reflections happen outside of your place of worship, when you are hanging out with friends? We have too, and that is the whole idea behind Theology on Tap.  Our Theology on Tap is for those who embrace the questions, rather than those who embrace answers - meaning that if you are hoping to tell everyone your "truth," but are unwilling to listen to the "truth" of others, this isn't for you.  This is for people of all faiths, all denominations within faiths, and those who are seekers.  And, as a result, it has really taken off! Past topics have included “Pluralism: How can we talk about God without killing each other?”, “Faith: What’s that all about?”, and “Why are we here?: An exploration of the meaning of our existence.” The topic in January will be “A New Year, A New Faith?: What questions and challenges do we need to explore in the year ahead, and which spiritual practices are best for you?”

For directions, go to the Fitzgerald’s website by clicking on this link: http://www.fitzgeralds1928.com/
results.name: Theology on Tap

results.description:
GET TICKETS
SAVE THIS EVENT
SUN, JUN 19, 2016 AT 7:00 PM
Personal Freedom Mastery Workshops
SunMoon Yoga, Jersey City, NJ
Event Description


If you feel overwhelmed or stuck in a never ending transition, feeling like you are chasing your own tail and never moving forward, chances are you are being held back by old stories, fears and patterns that are keeping your life in limbo. Personal Freedom Mastery offers the antidote to the limiting beliefs and energetic patterns that hold you back. This workshop will energize and inspire you to create your life from the inside-out, and will help uncover the magnificent you, and the limitless possibilities that were always there.

Using powerful exercises and tools based in Toltec tradition, including techniques from shamanic and healing traditions, you will get to the root of limiting beliefs, release energetic blocks and patterns, and strengthen your awareness to reclaim your personal freedom to create your life.

Included in the workshops (varies) will be:

- Grounding / Shielding exercises

- Dreaming meditation- Recapitulation

- Guided Meditations for healing/balancing

- Tapping for balancing / release

- Shamanic healing techniques

- Body re-energizing techniques

- Open time for sharing / support - Closing ceremony

These are powerful workshops that will be the catalyst for your transformation and personal freedom mastery.

RSVP: www.christinevida.eventbrite.com
results.name: Personal Freedom Mastery Workshops
